intro: Ardisia ochracea, commonly known as the yellow ardisia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces bright red, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for various birds and mammals. Ardisia ochracea typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural use in shaded gardens.
